msContents.summary: Letter to Asklepiades the dioiketes asking him to act on Isidoros

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank; ca. half of the letter is misssing
16 lines of writing by a clear, professional hand, the same as in P.Mich.inv. 1674; the last 2 lines of a subscription are written in a smaller and faster hand, the writer

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 1923; no. 18 (original no. V.C.86) in Bell

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: NN to Asklepiades the dioiketes, (hearty) greetings. Isidoros, who is delivering the letter to you, is . . ., and he is from the village of Psophthis of the Memphite. When he was detained by the agents of Tryphon the strategos, he signed a sworn undertaking concerning the sowing of five and a half arouras near the village of Philadelphia from the revenue-estate of Livia . . . I ask you therefore to investigate if concerning . . . to cooperate with him so that he may be undisturbed in the matter concerning which he made the sworn statement . . . and for the future . . . Farewell.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. VIII 211 Published by Chan-Hie Kim, "The form and Structure of the Familiar Greek Letter of Recommendation" (Society of Biblical Literature Dissertation Series 4, Missoula 1972) 205; about the Archive, see A. Hanson, BASP 21 (1984) 77-87. Correction in BL X p. 42
